ranked_diseases.explanation: Perfect match with all patient phenotypes (macrodontia, short stature, hand abnormalities, delayed skeletal maturation) and all three reference cases diagnosed as KBG syndrome with identical features.
Features short stature, skeletal abnormalities including hand defects, and delayed bone age. Dental anomalies can occur, though macrodontia is less typical than in KBG syndrome.
Characterized by short stature, delayed skeletal maturation, and Madelung deformity of the hands/wrists. Dental anomalies are less common but possible.
Features short stature, hand abnormalities (oligodactyly, clinodactyly), and delayed bone age. Dental anomalies occur but macrodontia is not typical.
Can present with short stature, skeletal abnormalities including hand defects, and dental anomalies. Delayed skeletal maturation is possible but less prominent.
